00047 /* Ye good olde min/max macros. No library would be complete without them. */
00048 
00049 #define cc_min(x, y) (((x) < (y)) ? (x) : (y))
00050 #define cc_max(x, y) (((x) > (y)) ? (x) : (y))

00054 /* Include this to 1) be compatible with Open Inventor's SbBasic.h, 2)
00055  * provide a way for application programmers to get hold of the type
00056  * definitions without explicitly including inttypes.h.
00057  *
00058  * The latter point is important because the inttypes.h file in SGI
00059  * and TGS Open Inventor is placed _below_ the Inventor/ directory in
00060  * the header files hierarchy. This is a stupid thing to do because it
00061  * could easily conflict with the inttypes.h file installed as part of
00062  * the C library on many systems (like GNU/Linux's glibc, for
00063  * instance).
00064  */
00065 #include <Inventor/system/inttypes.h>
00066 
00067 /* Internal note for Coin developers: in other sourcefiles in Coin, we
00068  * depend on math.h being included through SbBasic.h. It is done this
00069  * way to always make sure we have the M_* symbols available under
00070  * MSWin (see below). So don't remove the following line unless you
00071  * know very well what you are doing.
00072  */
00073 #include <math.h>

00169 /* This define is set by the configure script if singleprecision math
00170    functions are available from the C library API headers. */
00171 /* #undef HAVE_SINGLEPRECISION_MATH */
00172 
00173 /* Most compilers should have "hash quoting", as it is part of the
00174    ANSI standard. */
00175 #define HAVE_HASH_QUOTING 1
00176 /* #undef HAVE_APOSTROPHES_QUOTING */

00184 /* *********************************************************************** */
00185 
00186 #ifndef HAVE_SINGLEPRECISION_MATH
00187 /* If singleprecision math functions are missing, define them to their
00188    doubleprecision counterparts. This is done to be consistent with
00189    SbBasic.h in Open Inventor (application programmers might rely on
00190    the float-versions being set up from the Inventor SbBasic.h).
00191    When Coin is used together with other libraries, those libraries may
00192    also define some of these, so we try to avoid #define conflicts by
00193    wrapping each define. */
00194 #ifndef cosf
00195 #define cosf(x) ((float)cos(x))
00196 #endif /* !cosf */
00197 #ifndef sinf
00198 #define sinf(x) ((float)sin(x))
00199 #endif /* !sinf */
00200 #ifndef tanf
00201 #define tanf(x) ((float)tan(x))
00202 #endif /* !tanf */
00203 #ifndef powf
00204 #define powf(x, y) ((float)pow(x, y))
00205 #endif /* !powf */
00206 #ifndef sqrtf
00207 #define sqrtf(x) ((float)sqrt(x))
00208 #endif /* !sqrtf */
00209 #ifndef acosf
00210 #define acosf(x) ((float)acos(x))
00211 #endif /* !acosf */
00212 #ifndef asinf
00213 #define asinf(x) ((float)asin(x))
00214 #endif /* !asinf */
00215 #ifndef atanf
00216 #define atanf(x) ((float)atan(x))
00217 #endif /* !atanf */
00218 #ifndef atan2f
00219 #define atan2f(x, y) ((float)atan2(x, y))
00220 #endif /* !atan2f */
00221 #endif /* HAVE_SINGLEPRECISION_MATH */

00226 /* SO__QUOTE(str)        - use the preprocessor to quote a string.
00227  * SO__CONCAT(str1,str2) - use the preprocessor to concatenate two strings.
00228  */
00229 
00230 #ifdef HAVE_HASH_QUOTING
00231 #define SO__QUOTE(str)           #str
00232 #define SO__CONCAT(str1, str2)   str1##str2
00233 #elif defined(HAVE_APOSTROPHES_QUOTING)
00234 #define SO__QUOTE(str)           "str"
00235 #define SO__CONCAT(str1, str2)   str1str2
00236 #else
00237 #error No valid way to do macro quoting!
00238 #endif

00240 /* *********************************************************************** */
00241 
00242 /* Precaution to avoid an some errors easily made by the application
00243    programmer. */
00244 #ifdef COIN_DLL_API
00245 # error Leave the internal COIN_DLL_API define alone.
00246 #endif /* COIN_DLL_API */
00247 #ifdef COIN_INTERNAL
00248 # ifdef COIN_NOT_DLL
00249 #  error The COIN_NOT_DLL define is not supposed to be used when building the library, only when building Win32 applications.
00250 # endif /* COIN_INTERNAL && COIN_NOT_DLL */
00251 # ifdef COIN_DLL
00252 #  error The COIN_DLL define is not supposed to be used when building the library, only when building Win32 applications.
00253 # endif /* COIN_INTERNAL && COIN_DLL */
00254 #endif /* COIN_INTERNAL */
00255 
00256 /*
00257   On MSWindows platforms, one of these defines must always be set when
00258   building application programs:
00259 
00260    - "COIN_DLL", when the application programmer is using the library
00261      in the form of a dynamic link library (DLL)
00262 
00263    - "COIN_NOT_DLL", when the application programmer is using the
00264      library in the form of a static object library (LIB)
00265 
00266   Note that either COIN_DLL or COIN_NOT_DLL _must_ be defined by the
00267   application programmer on MSWindows platforms, or else the #error
00268   statement will hit. Set up one or the other of these two defines in
00269   your compiler environment according to how the library was built --
00270   as a DLL (use "COIN_DLL") or as a LIB (use "COIN_NOT_DLL").
00271 
00272   (Setting up defines for the compiler is typically done by either
00273   adding something like "/DCOIN_DLL" to the compiler's argument line
00274   (for command-line build processes), or by adding the define to the
00275   list of preprocessor symbols in your IDE GUI (in the MSVC IDE, this
00276   is done from the "Project"->"Settings" menu, choose the "C/C++" tab,
00277   then "Preprocessor" from the dropdown box and add the appropriate
00278   define)).
00279 
00280   It is extremely important that the application programmer uses the
00281   correct define, as using "COIN_NOT_DLL" when "COIN_DLL" is correct
00282   will cause mysterious crashes.
00283  */
00284 /* FIXME: use a feature check to see if this is a platform which can
00285    recognize the __declspec keyword instead of the crap #if below.
00286    20011201 mortene. */
00287 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(__NT__)
00288 # ifdef COIN_INTERNAL
00289 #  ifdef COIN_MAKE_DLL
00290 #   define COIN_DLL_API __declspec(dllexport)
00291 #  endif /* COIN_MAKE_DLL */
00292 # else /* !COIN_INTERNAL */
00293 #  ifdef COIN_DLL
00294 #   ifdef COIN_NOT_DLL
00295 #     error Define _either_ COIN_DLL _or_ COIN_NOT_DLL as appropriate for your linkage -- not both at the same time! See Inventor/C/basic.h for further instructions.
00296 #   endif /* COIN_NOT_DLL */
00297 #   define COIN_DLL_API __declspec(dllimport)
00298 #  else /* !COIN_DLL */
00299 #   ifndef COIN_NOT_DLL
00300 #    error Define either COIN_DLL or COIN_NOT_DLL as appropriate for your linkage! See Inventor/C/basic.h for further instructions.
00301 #   endif /* COIN_NOT_DLL */
00302 #  endif /* !COIN_DLL */
00303 # endif /* !COIN_INTERNAL */
00304 #endif /* Microsoft Windows */
00305 
00306 /* Empty define to avoid errors when _not_ compiling an MSWindows DLL. */
00307 #ifndef COIN_DLL_API
00308 # define COIN_DLL_API
00309 #endif /* !COIN_DLL_API */
